title.native: 監獄学園〈プリズンスクール〉

description:
Hachimitsu Private Academy was a revered and elite all-girls' boarding school on the outskirts of Tokyo...once upon a time. But with the new school year comes a revision to school policy: Boys are to be admitted into the student body for the first time ever. But on his first day at Hachimitsu, Kiyoshi Fujino discovers that he's one of only five boys enrolled at the school. Their numbers overwhelmed by the thousand girls in the student body, is it heaven or hell that awaits these five (un)fortunates?!.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: โรงเรียนคุกนรก

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Prison
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a prison.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Large Breasts
tags.description: Features a character with larger-than-average breasts.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Torture
tags.description: The act of deliberately inflicting severe pain or suffering upon another individual or oneself as a punishment or with a specific purpose.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Femdom
tags.description: Female Dominance. Features sexual acts with a woman in a dominant position.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiramoto_akira)

Debuted in 1995 with "Sono Tomodachi ni Gimon Ari" story in Weekly Young Magazine under pen name Hiramoto Akira (平本明).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/278548957) | [Blog](https://blog.goo.ne.jp/mizshima1941)

__Height:__ 174 cm (5'8'') 

[Profile](https://intention-k.com/profile/kenichi_suzumura) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/suzu__kensan)

His favorite animals are dogs, and he has two dogs named Ivy and Momo. His favorite foods are curry and Pino ice cream. He enjoys cooking and playing video games. He can speak in the Kansai-ben dialect. He has a younger brother, Masaki, and an older sister, Shizuka. He has practiced aikido.  

He left Artvision in 2012 and has found his own talent agency INTENTION. He is part of the voice actor unit STA☆MEN, alongside Junichi Suwabe, Daisuke Kishio, Hiroki Takahashi, Hiroyuki Yoshino, Makoto Yasumura, and Kousuke Toriumi. They performed the ending theme for the Tokusatsu drama "Go Busters" of the Super Sentai Series and released it as their third single. He's also part of CONNECT, first unit of Kiramune, with Mitsuo Iwata. They released three mini-albums and a single. As a solo artist, he has released 13 singles, 3 albums and 2 mini-albums.  

Married frequent costar [Maaya Sakamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/95090/Maaya-Sakamoto) on August 8, 2011.
**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/106221091)

Affiliated with [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/106221091)

Affiliated with [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/).

[Official Website](http://www.okenkikaku.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/puku1048) | [Blog](https://o-ken.blog.so-net.ne.jp/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大槻ケンヂ)

Kenji Ootsuki is a Japanese rock musician and Seiun Award winning writer from Tokyo. His musical career began in the late 1970s to early 1980s. He is the vocalist of [Kinniku Shoujo Tai](https://anilist.co/staff/280201), Tokusatsu, Underground Searchlie and Karate Bakabon.

__[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/kumanokiyomi/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyokinomaku) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kiyomi.kumano)__

__Birthplace.__ Gifu Prefecture, Japan
__Residency:__ Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan

__Kiyomi Kumano__ is a freelance Japanese vocalist and lyricist.

**Height:** 175cm

[Profile (Kekke)](http://www.kekke.co.jp/talent/male/ak/okitsu.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/okitsu3__8)

Kazuyuki Okitsu is a Japanese voice actor and narrator. After he graduated from the Osaka University of Arts he was initially represented by the REM talent agency but from May, 2007 he has been affiliated with Kekke Corporation. When he was a 3rd year high school student he was the moderator for the 79th Japanese High School Baseball Championship opening ceremony. 

__Non-Anime Roles:__ 
- Lúcio (Overwatch)
- Horropedia (Reverse: 1999)

**Height:** 167 cm (5'6") 
**Other:** Named his cat "Nyanko-Sensei" 
**Agency:** Aoni

[Profile](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/kamiya-hiroshi.html)

On January 1st 2025 it was announced that he had gotten married to actress and gravure model Rina Aizawa.

**Awards:**
- 2008-03: Best Supporting Actor, 2nd Annual Seiyuu Awards
- 2009-03: Best Lead Actor and Best Personality, 3rd Annual Seiyuu Awards
- 2012-03: Most Votes Award, 6th Annual Seiyuu Awards
- 2013-03: Most Votes Award, 7th Annual Seiyuu Awards  

Hosts several radio talk shows, including Dear Girl ~Stories~ with Ono Daisuke. In May 2010, he and Miyu Irino formed a Kiramune unit called KAmiYU, and sang the theme song for Mokei Senshi Gunpla Builders Beginning G.  Their first mini-album "link-up" was released on August 3, 2011.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Neuvillette in Genshin Impact
- Shou Ronpo in Uchu Sentai Kyuranger
- Madrex in Bakuage Sentai Boonboomger

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/121071138) | [Agency Profile](https://www.kenproduction.co.jp/talent/32)

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Altair Ibn La Ahad - Assassin's Creed (VG)
- Gosei Knight - Tensou Sentai Goseiger (Tokusatsu)
- Sakuya - Otori Rewrite (VG)
- Altair Ibn La Ahad - Assassin's Creed Revelations (VG)
- [Walter](https://anilist.co/character/184385/) - Shin Megami Tensei IV (VG)
- Jun Oda - Yakuza 0 (VG)
- Alfred - Bloodborne (VG)
- Olberic Eisenberg - Octopath Traveler (VG)
- Hooded Figure/Beelzebub - Granblue Fantasy (VG)
- [SilverAsh](https://anilist.co/character/175536/) - Arknights (VG)
- Boothill - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- Sylus - Love and Deepspace (VG)
- Noctis - Punishing: Gray Raven (VG)
- Shun Kanou - Persona 5: The Phantom X (VG)

__Alma Mater:__ Tokyo International University

[Website](https://kiramune.jp/artist/namikawa/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/namidai0402) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/namikawa--daisuke) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgrXnEIrI4LLgVYzGoQvJcg)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/quarter_law) | [Profile](http://www.undecided.co.jp/profile.html) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B8%AD%E5%B7%9D%E5%B9%B8%E5%A4%AA%E9%83%8E)

Japanese composer and arranger. He graduated from Tokyo University of the Arts' school of music. He is the son of musician and trumpet player Yoshihiro Nakagawa and older brother of the trombonist [Eijirou Nakagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/271401/Eijirou-Nakagawa). He has done music for various anime, dramas, films, and tokusatsu shows.

Nakagawa is known for collaborating with director [Gorou Taniguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/98066/Gorou-Taniguchi), and has written and composed the scores for many of his projects since [s-CRY-ed](https://anilist.co/anime/168/sCRYed/) in 2001. Including the acclaimed [Code Geass](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Lelouch-of-the-Rebellion/) series. Outside anime, he is also noted for his work on many Super Sentai and Kamen Rider series.

**Notable works outside anime as composer:**
~!- Hyakujuu Sentai Gaoranger (tokusatsu, TV series, 2001)
- GoGo Sentai Boukenger (tokusatsu, TV series, 2006)
- Kamen Rider Decade (tokusatsu, TV series, 2009) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider W (tokusatsu, TV series, 2009-10) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider OOO (tokusatsu, TV series, 2010) 
- Kamen Rider Wizard (tokusatsu, TV series, 2012-13)
- Kamen Rider Drive (tokusatsu, TV series, 2014) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider Revice (tokusatsu, TV series, 2021)!~
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/278548957) | [Blog](https://blog.goo.ne.jp/mizshima1941)

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

Sakurabi made his directional debut with [Gunparade March](https://anilist.co/anime/266/). He is a fan of simple and refreshing love stories. As a director he's known for modifying original stories a lot, which has brought him substantial amounts of critique. He is quite infamous for his work as the director of the [Tsukihime](https://anilist.co/anime/169/) adaptation, with most fans disapproving of his changes from the original visual novel.

Amongst his most notable directorial works are [Yomigaeru Sora: Rescue Wings](https://anilist.co/anime/798/) and [Flying Witch](https://anilist.co/anime/21284/).

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/), where he is one of the studio's leading animators. His drawing corrections as animation director are known for his advanced drawing skills. Additionally, he is occasionally entrusted with powerful character acting and action sequences.
Soutarou Shimizu is an animator.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/koba_bako_koba)

Affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/MAPPA).

Affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/MAPPA).
